175.title: India advises return to dialogue, diplomacy: Jaishankar in Russia amid Ukraine war
175.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday commented on the Ukraine war during a press conference with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and said, "India strongly advocates a return to dialogue and diplomacy." He said the consequences of the war are visible. "The global economy is...too interdependent for significant conflict anywhere not to have major [impacts] elsewhere," he added.

176.title: Varun Dhawan's 'Bhediya' to premiere at IFFI Goa
176.article_body: Varun Dhawan's 'Bhediya' will premiere at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI), which is to be held in Goa from November 20-28. As per a source, Varun, along with Kriti Sanon, Abhishek Banerjee and director Amar Kaushik, will attend the event. Apart from 'Bhediya', 'The Storyteller' and 'India Lockdown' will also premiere at the festival.

177.title: Rahul should apologise: MP Minister on Cong leader's 'Hindu' remark
177.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday demanded an apology from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu'. "Rahul Gandhi should apologise for the derogatory remarks...I will write a letter to him to clarify what Congress thinks about 'Hindu' and 'Hindutva'," Mishra added.

178.title: Help free Indian sailors held in Equatorial Guinea: Kerala CM to PM
178.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday sought PM Narendra Modi's intervention to facilitate the release of 16 Indian sailors, including three from Kerala, held hostage in Equatorial Guinea. Vijayan, in his letter, said that the crew of the ship did not engage in any unlawful activities and a further delay in bringing them back would make their lives unsafe.

179.title: 'RRR' beats '3 Idiots' to become 3rd highest-grossing Indian film in Japan
179.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' has beaten Aamir Khan's '3 Idiots' to become the third highest-grossing Indian film in Japan. 'RRR' collected around ¥180 million (₹10 crore) in the country. The film is now behind Rajamouli's Baahubali 2: The Conclusion, which collected ¥300 million (₹16.75 crore), and Rajinikanth's 1995 film 'Muthu', which collected ¥400 million (₹22 crore).

180.title: Will do everything to ensure Chhawla rape victim gets justice: U'khand CM
180.article_body: After the SC acquitted the three accused in the 2012 Chhawla rape case, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami assured that the 19-year-old victim, who was raped and killed, would get justice. "I have spoken to [the] advocate...and Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju…The victim is the daughter of our country...we will do everything to ensure that she gets justice," said Dhami.

181.title: Territorial integrity a key condition to resume talks with Russia: Ukraine
181.article_body: Ukraine's National Security and Defence Council Secretary Oleksiy Danilov has said that the main condition for resumption of negotiations with Russia is restoration of Ukraine's territorial integrity. On Monday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he was open to only "genuine" negotiations that would restore Ukraine's borders.

182.title: Jubilant Foodworks Q2 net profit rises by 9.8% to ₹131.5 crore
182.article_body: Jubilant Foodworks, which operates Domino's Pizza and Dunkin' Donuts in India, posted a 9.8% rise in net profit at ₹131.5 crore for the September quarter as against ₹119.8 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The company's revenue from operations rose by 16.6% to ₹1,301.5 crore as compared to ₹1,116.2 crore in the year-ago period.

183.title: K'taka Cong to approach HC against order to block Twitter handles
183.article_body: Karnataka Congress will file a writ petition in the Karnataka High Court seeking to quash an order by a lower court directing Twitter to temporarily block the accounts of the Congress party and Bharat Jodo Yatra over alleged illegal use of sound records of 'KGF: Chapter 2' movie. Earlier, Congress said it hadn't received a copy of the order.

184.title: Sudha Murthy touches feet of Hindutva activist Sambhaji Bhide; video surfaces
184.article_body: Philanthropist Sudha Murthy, the wife of Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy, met Hindutva activist Sambhaji Bhide during an event in Maharashtra's Sangli and touched his feet to take his blessings. Bhide, a key accused in the Bhima Koregaon violence case, was dropped from the case after no evidence was found against him. A former RSS activist, Bhide founded Shiv Pratishthan Hindustan.

185.title: Drugs were f**king delicious, almost died in 2007 of overdose: Eminem
185.article_body: Talking about his struggles with addiction, rapper Eminem shared that he "almost died from an overdose in 2007". "Because drugs were f**king delicious...I had to go and f**k it all up and take too many," he said. Stating that music saved his life, Eminem remembered how he had to fight his way through to try and breakthrough in music.

186.title: This is anti-national: K'taka CM over Cong leader's 'Hindu' remark
186.article_body: Following Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said this is anti-national and everyone should condemn it. "Is Rahul Gandhi and Siddaramaiah's silence endorsing Satish's statements?" CM Bommai asked. "They make statements with half knowledge to appease voters of one community and dream to get minority votes," he stated.

187.title: Ukraine receives first delivery of NASAMS air defence systems
187.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov has said that Ukraine received its first NASAMS and Aspide air defence systems. Reznikov thanked US, Spain and Norway, saying that Ukraine will continue to shoot down enemy targets. Last week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged G7 leaders to provide more help with air defence amid Russia's attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure.

188.title: Senior Congress leader KK Pandey dies during Rahul's Bharat Jodo Yatra
188.article_body: Senior Congress leader and general secretary of Congress Seva Dal, Krishna Kumar Pandey, died on Tuesday during Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra's Nanded. "He was walking along with me and Digvijaya Singh carrying the Tricolour. He handed over the flag to another person and about 15 minutes later he...suffered a heart attack," Congress' Jairam Ramesh said.

189.title: EAM Jaishankar meets Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Russia
189.article_body: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov held a meeting in Russia's Moscow today. "I believe this is the fifth time we're meeting this year and that speaks of long-term partnership and the importance we attach to each other. I'm really glad to be here...today to carry forward this dialogue," the EAM said in Moscow.

190.title: Chiratae Ventures raises $100 mn in 1st close of maiden growth fund
190.article_body: Chiratae Ventures, a venture capital firm that invests in early-stage startups, has secured $100 million in the first close of its maiden growth fund. It raised funds from investors including Kris Gopalakrishnan's family office, SBI and IIFL Wealth Management. Chiratae Ventures, founded in 2006, backed unicorns like Lenskart, cure.fit and Flipkart among others.

191.title: 73 infiltration bids reported in J&K in 2021, lowest in 5 yrs: Govt
191.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has revealed that 73 infiltration attempts from Pakistan were reported in 2021, the lowest in five years. "In 2017, as many as 419 infiltration attempts were reported. The number stood at 328 in 2018, 216 in 2019 and 99 in 2020," MHA said. It also added that militancy in J&K is directly linked with infiltration.

192.title: Policybazaar to face ₹560 crore of ESOP expenses in FY23
192.article_body: Insurance aggregator platform Policybazaar will face ₹560 crore of employee stock option (ESOP) expenses in FY23, the company said during an earnings call. The company added that the cost of ESOPs granted in October last year will reduce gradually over the next few years. Policybazaar granted ESOPs worth ₹1,044 crore to three top executives in FY22.

193.title: England will beat India in T20 WC 2022 semi-final: Kevin Pietersen
193.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen said he "really" thinks that England will beat India in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between the two sides on November 10 (Thursday). "There is a very good chance [that]...England [will take on] Pakistan [in the final]," added Pietersen. "I just need Virat Kohli to have a day off," he stated.

194.title: Renault, Google expand partnership to build 'software defined vehicle'
194.article_body: Renault and Google said on Tuesday that they are expanding their partnership in software services for future Renault vehicles. The "software-defined vehicle" will be built on Google's Android Automotive operating system and will send data to the company's cloud servers for processing. Google will become the preferred cloud supplier to the French automaker, the companies added.

195.title: Kerala Governor has lost his mental stability: CPI(M) state secretary
195.article_body: The CPI(M) on Tuesday distributed leaflets criticising Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan and pointed fingers at his mental stability. CPI(M) state secretary MV Govindan said, "He (the Governor) has lost his mental stability. On November 15, we will stage a never seen before  [demonstration] when one lakh people will protest [outside] the official residence of the Governor."

196.title: UP man keeps stolen ₹18 lakh in drum at home, says got idea from Dhol movie
196.article_body: A man from Uttar Pradesh, who used to work as a driver in Delhi, returned home with ₹18 lakh, which he had stolen from his employer, reports said. He hid the money inside a drum. After the money was recovered, he told police that the idea of hiding the money in a drum came to him from the movie 'Dhol'.

197.title: It's become Cong leaders' habit to demean Hindus: Thakur on Jarkiholi's remark
197.article_body: Following Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', BJP leader Anurag Thakur said it has become a habit for Congress and AAP leaders to demean Hindus and insult Hindu Gods and Goddesses. "Only during elections do they remember Gods and Goddesses. Rest of the time, they keep abusing them," Thakur added.

198.title: Didn't plan to fall in love with man with whom I can't live: Neena on Richards
198.article_body: Talking about her relationship with ex-West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, actress Neena Gupta said, "I didn't plan to fall in love with a person with whom I cannot live and have a child with him." "I never plan to do brave things in life...I never planned to show some act of bravery. I simply accepted...whatever God gave me," added Neena.

199.title: KKR to invest $400 mn in Vedanta's decarbonisation firm Serentica
199.article_body: Global investment firm KKR will invest $400 million in Serentica Renewables, a decarbonization platform that seeks to enable energy transition by providing clean energy solutions. Launched by Vedanta Group, Serentica plans to build 1,500 MW of solar and wind power projects in Karnataka, Maharashtra and Rajasthan. Serentica has entered into three long-term Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs).

200.title: Downturn in startup ecosystem to take 2-3 yrs to normalise: Zoho CEO
200.article_body: SaaS firm Zoho's Co-Founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu said the present economic downturn in the Indian tech and startup ecosystem could take two to three years to normalise. Vembu added, "At current pace, India could be our #2 market in four years and our top market in the next ten years." Chennai-based Zoho recently reported $1 billion in annual revenues.

201.title: Steel plant executive found dead at company's guest house in Odisha
201.article_body: A 59-year-old Jindal Steel and Power Limited plant executive was found dead in Odisha's Sundargarh, police said. The body of the deceased, who worked at a railway siding of the company's iron ore mines, was found by the caretaker of a guest house where he was staying. "It seemed someone hit his head with a blunt object," police added.

202.title: US man pleads guilty for obtaining $3.36 billion in crypto illegally
202.article_body: A US man pleaded guilty on November 4 to committing crypto fraud in September 2012 that amounted to $3.36 billion. The US Department of Justice seized $3.36 billion of bitcoin from James Zhong, who "unlawfully obtained" more than 50,000 bitcoin from dark web market Silk Road over 10 years ago. This was the second-largest financial seizure by the Justice Department.

203.title: Jarkiholi's remark on 'Hindu' his personal opinion, not party's: Shivakumar
203.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka Congress leader Satish Laxmanrao Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar said that his statement is his personal opinion and the party does not support it. "We will ask for his explanation on the same," he added. Jarkiholi on Sunday claimed that the word 'Hindu' hails from Persia and not India.

204.title: European Council Prez's speech for trade expo cancelled by China
204.article_body: The organisers of the 5th China International Import Expo held back a pre-recorded opening ceremony speech by the European Council president wherein he called for reduced EU trade dependency on China, European diplomats said. Charles Michel had also criticised Russia's "illegal war" in Ukraine in the pre-recorded message provided for the state-organised expo in Shanghai, the diplomats added.

205.title: BJP created illusion & smokescreen of growth in Gujarat: Congress
205.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said that BJP has created an "illusion and smokescreen" of high growth in Gujarat and is being ruled as a "vassal state of Delhi". Chidambaram asserted that the promise of a "double engine" government by the BJP was an "empty boast", adding that people, including Scheduled Tribes and women, have been left out.

206.title: UBS to hire 3 Credit Suisse bankers to tap Indian diaspora: Report
206.article_body: UBS Group is hiring three private bankers from the Credit Suisse Group to tap the wealthy Indian diaspora, Bloomberg reported. Gautam Anand, Akshay Menon and Gautam Bhargava will reportedly join UBS in Singapore next year. Anand joined Credit Suisse in 2013, according to his LinkedIn profile. Menon and Bhargava joined Credit Suisse in 2013 and 2010, respectively.

207.title: Hyderabad Police warns against fraud electricity bill messages
207.article_body: Hyderabad Police has warned about fraud messages that threaten to disconnect people's electricity supply if they do not pay the bill immediately. Sub-inspector Gaddam Mahesh said such messages direct victims to a fraudster, who asks them to download screen sharing applications like AnyDesk. The fraudster then steals bank details of the victims and withdraws money from their accounts, Mahesh added.

208.title: I thought we were going to get married: Olivia Culpo on ex-boyfriend Nick
208.article_body: Nick Jonas' ex-girlfriend Olivia Culpo opened up about her past relationship with the singer-songwriter and said that she was under the impression that they would get married. "I moved to LA with him. I had no brand, no money and I was in love...but when he broke up...I was kind of left with no sense of identity," Olivia added.

209.title: Nothing wrong with what I said: Cong leader on his 'Hindu' remark
209.article_body: Responding to his controversial remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi on Tuesday asserted that there was nothing wrong with what he said. Jarkiholi on Sunday said that the word 'Hindu' had Persian origins, adding that it has a "horrible and shameful" meaning. He further said that he'll resign as MLA if he's proven wrong.

210.title: 11 minors arrested in Hyderabad's hookah parlour raid
210.article_body: Hyderabad Detective Department's Special Crime Team raided a hookah parlour at Hyderabad's Himayatnagar and arrested 13 persons including 11 minors who were present there. The police also seized seven hookah pots, three hookah flavours, four alcohol bottles, 14 mobile phones and cash worth ₹2.03 lakh. The owner was running the hookah parlour in one converted portion of the house.

211.title: School van driver blackmails, rapes 14-year-old girl in Nagpur; arrested
211.article_body: Nagpur Police arrested a school van driver for allegedly raping a 14-year-old girl and blackmailing her by threatening to make her photographs viral. The accused allegedly raped her before dropping her off at school. According to the police, the accused kept on blackmailing the girl so that she would continue to be sexually exploited.

212.title: Why should I pay for blue tick now?: Woman who was among 1st Indians to join Twitter
212.article_body: Naina Redhu, who was among the first few Indians to join Twitter when it was launched in 2006, said Twitter's new monthly verification fee plan will not have much effect as it is 'not a necessity'. "If I haven't paid for this (blue tick) in the past 16 years then why should I (pay) now?" said Redhu.

213.title: Will resign if I'm wrong: K'taka Cong leader on his 'Hindu' remark
213.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA and KPCC Working President Satish Jarkiholi, who sparked controversy after saying that the word Hindu has a dirty meaning, has said if he is proven wrong he will resign as MLA. "Let everyone prove I'm wrong. If I am wrong, I'll resign as MLA and not just apologise for my statement," Jarkiholi said on Tuesday.

214.title: Nearly 3 lakh posters, banners removed in 2 days ahead of Delhi MCD polls
214.article_body: Nearly three lakh posters and banners were removed in two days since the Model of Code of Conduct came into effect ahead of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls. A total of 1,20,515 posters and other materials were removed on November 6 and the number increased to 2,91,996 by November 7. MCD elections will be held on December 4.

215.title: Japan repatriates ex-US soldier, son who helped ex-Nissan chief flee
215.article_body: Two Americans who were convicted in Japan for helping former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn escape to Lebanon have been repatriated to the US, their lawyer said on Tuesday. A court in July last year had awarded a prison sentence of two years to Michael Taylor, ex-US Special Forces member, and one year and eight months to his son, Peter Taylor.

216.title: PM Modi writes letter congratulating Palak Muchhal for her wedding, singer shares pic
216.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal, who tied the knot with music composer Mithoon Sharma, shared a letter by PM Narendra Modi, who congratulated the couple on their wedding. "Dear Modi ji, your...letter has touched our hearts. We express our gratitude to you for this respect and love," tweeted Palak. "It's a matter of privilege for us to get your blessings," she added.

217.title: What is Mastodon, the social network users are leaving Twitter for?
217.article_body: Thousands of people who quit Twitter after Elon Musk's takeover have joined Mastodon, a free, open-source decentralised social media platform that allows users to share media and follow other accounts. Mastodon consists of independent, user-managed servers and users are based on one server but can interact freely with others. Unlike Twitter, Mastodon presents posts in chronological order.

218.title: Akshay to revive 'Hera Pheri', 'Awara...' & 'Welcome' franchises: Report
218.article_body: Akshay Kumar is in talks with producer Firoz Nadiadwala to revive 'Hera Pheri', 'Awara Paagal Deewana' and 'Welcome' franchises. "The talks are on with three top directors, and we expect an...announcement on one of the three projects in next few months," a source was quoted as saying. Akshay will next be seen in 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' and 'OMG 2'.

219.title: Mom gets emotional for stupid people, wishes she'd got offers earlier: Masaba
219.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta's daughter Masaba Gupta said that her mother gets emotional for stupid people. "So I tell her, treat people for what they are," she said, adding, "She often says that she wishes that she had received offers earlier in life, just like she's getting now. But, I just keep telling her to be grateful and...enjoy."

220.title: If Suryakumar fails, Team India will struggle to get 140: Gavaskar
220.article_body: Ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, Sunil Gavaskar said India will "struggle" to score 140-150 if Suryakumar Yadav doesn't fire. "Suryakumar has got every shot in the book," added Gavaskar. Gavaskar further stated that India wouldn't have been able to score "even 150" in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe without Suryakumar's unbeaten 61.

221.title: Pune Metro allows passengers to book tickets through WhatsApp
221.article_body: Passengers of Pune Metro can book their QR code-enabled tickets through WhatsApp by sending 'Hi' to the WhatsApp number 9420101990 or by scanning the QR code available at metro stations. They can pay for their tickets and recharge via an integrated payment partner after choosing their travel details on WhatsApp. This service will be available in Marathi, Hindi and English.

222.title: Woman ends life in B'luru as lover threatens to leak private videos
222.article_body: A 35-year-old therapist committed suicide in Bengaluru after her lover demanded ₹2 lakh from her by threatening to upload their private videos online, police said on Tuesday. In a video shot before her death, Chamundeshwari wished her lover, Mallikarjun, good luck in life and asked him not to trouble women in future. Chamundeshwari's husband has filed a complaint against Mallikarjun.

223.title: New monogram for King Charles' wife Camilla revealed
223.article_body: The new monogram for King Charles' wife, Queen Consort Camilla, has been unveiled by Buckingham Palace. Designed by Professor Ewan Clayton, the monogram combines Camilla's initial "C" and "R" for Regina - the Latin word for queen. It will be used by Camilla on personal letterheads, cards and gifts.

224.title: Karan shelved 'Screw Dheela' as Tiger Shroff demanded ₹30 cr: Report
224.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar reportedly shelved 'Screw Dheela' after Tiger Shroff demanded ₹30 crore to do the film. As per a source, Tiger was "very excited" about the project and refused to discuss his fee with Karan. However, his team informed Karan about Tiger's ₹30 crore fee. "Karan tried to explain to Tiger's team...But they wouldn't budge," the source added.

225.title: Don't know if I handled things with grace: Vijay on 'Liger' failure
225.article_body: Talking about how he dealt with Liger's failure, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "I don't know if I've handled things with grace." He added that he's "very honest" about his emotions and expresses them as required. He said he will "always stand by" something that he "truly believes in" and will not be affected by how it is received.

226.title: German insurer Allianz halts paid ads on Twitter after Musk takeover
226.article_body: German insurer Allianz has joined the likes of General Motors, Audi, Volkswagen Group, Pfizer, Carlsberg Group, Mondelez International and General Mills to have suspended paid advertising on Twitter. The move comes after billionaire and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's takeover of the social media platform. Advertising agency Interpublic Group also advised its clients to suspend ads on Twitter.

227.title: Pay attention to your state, says Congress' Alka Lamba to UP CM Yogi
227.article_body: After Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath alleged that the Congress creates hurdles in development and welfare schemes, party leader Alka Lamba told the CM to pay attention to his own state. "Law and order [in UP] is weak. NCR cities like Noida, Ghaziabad...are hotspots of the crime world," said Lamba.

228.title: Dopamine hit from likes, shares extremely addictive: Zerodha CEO on social media
228.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath tweeted, "The dopamine hit from likes & shares is extremely addictive." He added, "Not getting consumed by social media while trying to build an audience has been one of the toughest things I have done in my life." He also said, "If the quality of content goes down, so will that of the audience."

229.title: Buttler, Hales need to be wary of inswingers vs India: Nasser Hussain
229.article_body: Former England captain Nasser Hussain has said that England openers Jos Buttler and Alex Hales will have to be wary of the inswingers while batting against India in their T20 World Cup match on Thursday. "Bhuvneshwar Kumar [against] Buttler and Hales at the top will be key...Then there is the spin threat of Axar Patel and Ravichandran Ashwin," added Hussain.

230.title: Woman, 2 minor daughters found murdered in their house in Rohtak
230.article_body: A 34-year-old woman and her two minor daughters were found murdered in their house in Kalanaur town in Haryana's Rohtak on Monday, police said. "Prima facie, it appeared...trio was strangulated to death...the woman's husband was arrested after her family alleged that he murdered them," police added. The woman's family claimed that the accused was an alcoholic, police stated.

231.title: MSRTC Pune to add new ST, electric buses; scrap 200 old buses
231.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) Pune division has decided to scrap 200 old state transport (ST) buses that have crossed their age limit, which is around 15 years. The corporation will add 50 more e-buses and 80 new ST buses. Currently, there are 448 ST buses and two e-buses in the Pune division.

232.title: Officer probing RSS worker's murder in Kerala allegedly gets death threat
232.article_body: The officer who is investigating the murder of RSS member Srinivasan in Kerala has filed a complaint claiming that he has been receiving threat calls. The officer alleged that a caller told him that he is creating problems and should "keep a coffin ready". So far, a total of 34 PFI workers have been arrested in the case, ANI reported.

233.title: Several parts of Delhi to face water supply disruption on Nov 9-10
233.article_body: Several areas of Delhi will face water supply disruption on the evening of November 9 and the morning of November 10, the Delhi Jal Board (DJB) announced on Monday. Areas including Majnu ka Tilla, Moolchand, Defence Colony, Greater Kailash, Hanuman Mandir and ITO will face water cuts on Wednesday and Thursday. DJB also shared a list of emergency contact numbers.

234.title: RRR will be minuscule in comparison: Rajamouli on Mahabharata adaptation
234.article_body: Discussing his desire to make a film based on Mahabharata, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said, "['RRR'] is minuscule and an ant's head...[compared to] what the [film on] Mahabharata can be." "However, the kind of imagery that I have...for the Mahabharata, I think I need more time, I need to learn more film craft to get it on the screen," added Rajamouli.

235.title: Donetsk 'littered' with Russian bodies as hundreds killed daily: Zelenskyy
235.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the Donetsk region in the east remained "the epicenter of the greatest madness of the occupiers [Russia]". "They're being killed in their hundreds every day. The ground in front of Ukrainian positions is littered with bodies of the occupiers," he added. Bakhmut and Avdiivka towns are the focal points of the heaviest fighting in Donetsk.

236.title: Attack on husband to impact my retirement decision: US House Speaker Pelosi
236.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has said that the recent incident, in which a hammer-wielding intruder attacked her husband Paul Pelosi, will have an impact on her decision about when to retire from Congress. In an interview with CNN, Pelosi said the hard part was knowing that she was the attacker's intended victim and her husband paid the price.

237.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu breaks down while speaking about battling Myositis, video surfaces
237.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who has been diagnosed with Myositis, broke down while talking about it in an interview. "There are days when I feel....I can't take one more step further. And there are days when I look back, I feel surprised that I've come so far," she said. "I'm here to fight...We win in the end," Samantha added.

238.title: 2,000-year-old tunnel discovered under temple in Egypt; pics released
238.article_body: Archaeologists in Egypt excavating beneath an ancient temple in the ancient city of Taposiris Magna have discovered a 1,300-metre-long tunnel dating back over 2,000 years. Archaeologist Kathleen Martinez said that during the excavations and survey of the tunnel, a part of the tunnel was discovered submerged under the Mediterranean water, a number of pottery vessels and pottery tractors were found.

239.title: 'Being gay is damage in mind,' Qatar World Cup envoy tells reporter; interview stopped
239.article_body: The 2022 FIFA World Cup ambassador Khalid Salman told a German journalist that homosexuality or being gay is "damage in the mind", after which a World Cup spokesperson stopped the interview. In a clip shared online, Salman is heard saying that homosexuality is "haram" or forbidden. Concerns have been raised over LGBTQ rights in Qatar ahead of the World Cup.

240.title: Rise in crime in Bihar since Nitish Kumar's alliance with RJD: Sushil Modi
240.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Monday said crime graph took a huge spike in Bihar ever since CM Nitish Kumar joined hands with the RJD and formed the government. "RJD is a party where criminals were given shelter in the past," Sushil Kumar Modi added. "Leaders like Raj Ballabh Yadav of Nawada...are involved in various criminal cases," he stated.

241.title: GreenCell receives $55 million debt funding to develop 255 e-buses
241.article_body: Electric bus manufacturing startup GreenCell has secured a $55 million financing package from Asian Development Bank, Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank and Clean Technology Fund to develop 255 electric battery-powered buses. The company received grants worth $5.2 million from Goldman Sachs and Bloomberg-backed Climate Innovation and Development Fund and $325,000 from Clean Technology Fund.

242.title: Sugarcane farmers stage protest in Pune over various demands
242.article_body: Sugarcane farmers from across Maharashtra took out protest march from Alka Chowk to Sugar Commissionerate office in Pune on Monday for their various demands from the state government. Some of their demands include - installation of digital weighing scales at sugar mills and they also demanded ₹350 per tonne for their produce apart from the Fair and Remunerative Price (FRP).

243.title: NCP leader booked for vandalism after stopping film screening in Thane
243.article_body: Nationalist Congress party leader Jitendra Awhad and 100 others have been booked for vandalism after they stooped the screening of a Marathi film 'Har Har Mahadev' in Thane. Awhad alleged that the movie showcases wrong history about Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. He said that people are influenced by movies and they won't let them change history.

244.title: 5 people injured in cylinder blast in Mumbai's Vile Parle
244.article_body: Five people were injured in a cylinder blast which took place at New Kalpana Chawl in Vile Parle, Mumbai on Tuesday. It was a level-1 cylinder blast and was reported around 6 am, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said. The injured have been identified as Amar Rai (27), Jayram Yadav (27), Harekumar Rai (38), Rakeshkumar Rai (30) and Arunkumar Rai (45).

245.title: 3 including couple who stole 73 vehicles in Delhi, Gurugram held
245.article_body: Three people, including a couple, were arrested for stealing 73 vehicles in Delhi and Gurugram, police said on Monday. Two vehicles, which were stolen from Gurugram, were recovered after the accused were interrogated and their licence plates were also seized, the police added. The accused would steal vehicles and supply them to northeast states, the police further said.

246.title: B'luru Police raids 3 illegal hookah bars, books staff members
246.article_body: The Bengaluru Police carried out raids at three hookah bars operating illegally and beyond the permissible time in the city, a senior police official tweeted on Monday. "Seized equipment, hookah flavours and total cash worth ₹14,000 from three hookah bars," he added. Reportedly, the police also booked the managers and staff members of the hookah bars.

247.title: Education not a business to earn profit, tuition fee must be affordable: SC
247.article_body: The Supreme Court observed that education is not a business to earn profit and the tuition fee shall always be affordable. A bench of justices MR Shah and Sudhanshu Dhulia made these remarks while upholding Andhra Pradesh High Court's order which set aside the state government's decision to enhance the tuition fee payable by the MBBS students.

248.title: Shaheen holds the key for Pakistan's progression in T20 WC: Ponting
248.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said pacer Shaheen Afridi holds the key for Pakistan's progression in the ongoing T20 World Cup. "Shaheen might say that he's not back to 100% just yet, but from what I've seen it looks like he's going along beautifully," stated Ponting. Shaheen picked four wickets in their must-win Super 12 match against Bangladesh.

249.title: 'Musk's hellscape', 'free hate speech' projected on Twitter HQ's wall, pics surface
249.article_body: A California based-activist projected "Musk's hellscape" and "free hate speech" on the wall of Twitter's headquarters in San Francisco. Sharing pictures of the phrases he projected on the wall, Alan Marling wrote, "Elon [Musk] seems to have no concept of free speech, so projected an example on Twitter HQ." Musk acquired Twitter on October 27 in a $44 billion deal.

250.title: Shami shares pic from forest, says 'No Wi-Fi, but I promise you'll find better connection'
250.article_body: Ahead of India's semi-final match against England in the ongoing T20 World Cup, Mohammad Shami took to Twitter to share a photo of him relaxing in Australia. "There's no Wi-Fi in the forest, but I promise you'll find a better connection," he captioned the photo. Shami has picked six wickets in India's five games so far in the tournament.

251.title: Rahul Gandhi offers prayers at gurudwara in Maha, resumes 'padyatra'
251.article_body: On the occasion of Guru Nanak Jayanti, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited a gurudwara in the Nanded district of Maharashtra just before the commencement of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Tuesday. He took to Twitter and said, "By applying Guru Nanak's teachings of love, peace and brotherhood, we will fulfil [the] resolve to unite India. Lakhs of greetings...to all."

252.title: 2 held for allegedly running over former intelligence officer in Mysore University campus
252.article_body: An MBA graduate and his friend have been arrested for allegedly running over 82-year-old former Intelligence Bureau officer inside Mysore University campus. Police said they murdered him over property dispute. The officer was walking inside campus when he was hit by a car. It was earlier believed that it was an accident but speculations of it being murder surfaced later.

253.title: Will make a big announcement on November 15: ex-US President Trump
253.article_body: During a political rally in US state of Ohio, former US President Donald Trump said he would make a "big announcement" on November 15 at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Florida. Trump declined to elaborate, saying he didn't want to detract from important and critical election. He said US is a "nation in decline" under the leadership of President Joe Biden.

254.title: Sah Polymers gets SEBI approval to float IPO
254.article_body: Polymer manufacturer Sah Polymers has received the market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India's (SEBI) approval to raise funds through an Initial Public Offering (IPO). According to draft papers, Sah Polymers' IPO will be a fresh issue of 1.02 crore equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. The Udaipur-based company had filed preliminary IPO papers with SEBI in April.

255.title: Off-duty pilot objects to flyers using business-class toilet amid medical emergency
255.article_body: The crew of Kozhikode-Delhi Air India flight has filed a complaint against an off-duty AI Express pilot after a medical emergency on Sunday. A passenger was unwell and he was made to lie down in the aisle near a washroom. The crew then allowed economy-class passengers to use the business-class washroom but the pilot objected and ranted for 15 minutes.

256.title: Delhi Metro introduces its first 8-coach trains on Red Line
256.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) introduced its first-ever set of two eight-coach trains on Red Line, which have been converted from the existing fleet of 39 six-coach trains. These metros will run from Rithala to Shaheed Sthal New Bus Adda starting today. DMRC is also undertaking conversion of remaining six-coach trains on Red, Yellow and Blue lines, officials said.

257.title: Suffered, endured & enjoyed: Neena on being single mother to Masaba
257.article_body: Neena Gupta said that she took the decision to give birth to her daughter Masaba Gupta out of wedlock and stood by it despite hardships. "I suffered, endured and also enjoyed all that (phase)," she said, adding that she never took any sort of financial or emotional help from anyone. She added that she "simply accepted" God's plans for her.

258.title: Today's lunar eclipse to be visible from B'luru, will last for 29 mins
258.article_body: Today's lunar eclipse will be visible from Bengaluru and will last for 29 minutes. "For...Bengaluru...at the time of moonrise, the partial eclipse after...end of totality will be in progress and...the duration from the moonrise time up to the end of the partial eclipse will be...29 minutes," the Ministry of Earth Sciences said. The total eclipse will end at 5:12 pm.

259.title: Drunk man kills 2-year-old son for crying in Hyderabad
259.article_body: A man, who was in an inebriated condition, allegedly killed his two-year-old son in Hyderabad's Neredmet on Monday night. "Frustrated over the cries of the child, the accused hit him against the ground. The child sustained injuries and died," an official of Neredmet police station said. The man was taken into police custody.

260.title: A competitor's trying to go after us: FTX CEO on 'false' insolvency rumours
260.article_body: FTX's billionaire Founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried said, "FTX is fine. Assets are fine," amid insolvency rumours after its competitor Binance announced plans to liquidate its entire holdings of FTX's native tokens. "A competitor is trying to go after us with false rumours," he tweeted, adding that FTX keeps "audited financials" and is "highly regulated".

261.title: 5 wagons of goods train derail in Jhansi; rail traffic affected
261.article_body: Five wagons of a goods train derailed in Jhansi's Virangana Lakshmibai railway station yard on Tuesday, rail officials said. The derailment, which took place around 5.30 am, has affected both up and down traffic on Jhansi-Mustra and Jhansi-Karari sections, the PRO said. The PRO added that efforts are on to restore services and that some trains were diverted.

262.title: President Murmu and PM Modi wish everyone on Guru Nanak Jayanti
262.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone a happy Guru Nanak Jayanti. President Murmu urged people to adopt the teachings of Japji Sahib, like truth, sacrifice and moral conduct. PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "May his noble teachings continue to guide us in our endeavour of building a...compassionate society."

263.title: China playing aggressive games with Canada democracy: Trudeau
263.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said that China is playing "aggressive games" with democracies and Canadian institutions. This comes after a local media report claimed that China had funded a "clandestine network" of candidates in Canada's 2019 election. The report also alleged that Beijing sought to place agents in the offices of members of the Parliament in order to influence policy.

264.title: Special players don't stay down for long: Hayden on Babar, Rizwan
264.article_body: Speaking ahead of their semi-final against New Zealand in the T20 World Cup, Pakistan mentor Matthew Hayden backed their openers Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan to regain form, stating that special players don't stay down for long. "Babar and Rizwan rightly are [the] number one combination," he added. Babar has scored 39 runs in five innings in the ongoing tournament.

265.title: Ashwin reacts to viral video of him smelling jackets during toss against Zimbabwe
265.article_body: India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has reacted after he was caught on camera smelling warm-up jackets during toss against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022. On being asked by Abhinav Mukund about his logic of picking the right "sweater", Ashwin tweeted, "Checked for...sizes to differentiate! (didn't work) Checked if it was initialed (didn't work) Finally checked for...the perfume i use (worked)."

266.title: 'Are you going to pay $8, Elon?' asks Twitter user on blue tick fee, Musk says '100%'
266.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday shared a photo of a T-shirt with a text that read, "Your feedback is appreciated. Now pay $8", a response he had given to US lawmaker Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez regarding the $8 blue tick subscription service. Commenting on it, a Twitter user wrote, "Are you going to pay the $8, Elon?" to which he replied 100%.

267.title: UPI frauds led to 15.3% rise in cybercrime complaints between Q1, Q2 in 2022: MHA
267.article_body: The unified payments interface (UPI) frauds contributed to a 15.3% increase in the overall number of complaints reported on the National Cybercrime Reporting Portal between the first and second quarters of 2022, the Ministry of Home Affairs data showed. The overall number of registered complaints in Q1 of 2022 was 2,06,198, while it grew to 2,37,658 in the second quarter.

268.title: Dead cobra found in Ghaziabad society's water tank, police complaint filed
268.article_body: A dead cobra was found inside the water tank of a society in Ghaziabad. Reports said that the residents of the society had been complaining of skin rashes and stomach infections. A police complaint was lodged against the developer of the society. The residents claimed the snake was found in the tank that stored drinking water.

269.title: Man cuts childhood friend's private parts, stuffs them in his mouth in Maharashtra
269.article_body: A 21-year-old hotel owner was murdered by his childhood friend who stabbed him nine times, cut his private parts and stuffed them in his mouth in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. Aslam Ansari used to like Shamim Ansari's girlfriend and when Shamim refused to leave her he murdered him. The incident happened when they were having a party in the hotel of deceased.

270.title: BBMP invites applications to hire 63 doctors at Namma Clinics in B'luru
270.article_body: After completing the process of appointing 180 doctors last month, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) invited applications to hire 63 more doctors. The clinics are scheduled to open on December 15, officials said. Out of 438 Namma Clinics across Karnataka, 243 will be operational in Bengaluru. We hope to complete the hiring process this month, a BBMP official said.

271.title: 1,800 Bihar healthcare centres issued closure warning over waste disposal
271.article_body: The Bihar State Pollution Control Board (BSPCB) said it has issued closure warning notices to 1,800 healthcare centres in six districts across the state for not complying with the norms of bio-medical waste disposal. If these centres fail to adhere to the norms of treatment of medical waste within 15 days, their closure will be ordered, BSPCB added.

272.title: Delhi HC awards Louis Vuitton ₹20 lakh in trademark violation case against Club Factory
272.article_body: The Delhi High Court has awarded ₹20 lakh to Louis Vuitton in its trademark infringement suit against Club Factory, a Chinese e-shopping platform that was banned in India. In the suit filed in 2020, Louis Vuitton alleged that the Club Factory website indulged in the unauthorised sale of its products that carried the marks of Louis Vuitton.

273.title: Situation is tough, no one is going to theatres: Amitabh Bachchan
273.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has requested fans to buy tickets and watch films at theatres. He said, "Aajkal badi maramari chal ri hai, koi ja hi nahi raha hai theatre mein (The situation is very tough these days. No one is going to the theatre)." Adding to him, Neena Gupta informed that the tickets for their upcoming film 'Uunchai' will cost ₹150.

274.title: Suryakumar's record against slow left-arm spin doesn't stand out: Hussain
274.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain termed Suryakumar Yadav as a "freakish talent", but added that his record against slow left-arm spin "doesn't really stand out". "It is hard to find any weakness," stated Hussain. Ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis had earlier termed "bombarding" Suryakumar with short deliveries as the best as well as the "only way" to dismiss him in T20s.

275.title: Several actors have wrong intentions from the beginning of a film: Boney
275.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor said there are several actors who have "wrong" intentions from the beginning of a film. "[Their] first thought process is dishonest...The film won't be successful in case of an absence of honesty," added Boney. "Several actors charge fully for 25-30 days of work...There are quite a few actors who want everything to be convenient," he stated.

276.title: Man sexually exploits woman on pretext of marriage in Pune
276.article_body: A case has been filed after a man allegedly sexually exploited a 31-year-old woman on the pretext of marriage in Pune. The woman said in her complaint that when she asked about the marriage later, the accused refused and physically assaulted her, according to police officials. The accused and the woman are both members of a library, police said.

277.title: Punjab man gets trapped in fire caused by stubble burning; rescued
277.article_body: A 29-year-old man suffered burn injuries after he got trapped in a fire caused by stubble burning in Punjab's Ferozepur on Monday. Passers-by had rescued the man, however, his two-wheeler was reportedly reduced to ashes in the incident. The man, who is a barber, claimed that he had fallen unconscious after getting trapped in the fire.

278.title: Versova-Andheri metro ridership rises after Gokhale bridge closure
278.article_body: Ridership of stations in Mumbai's Andheri, namely Versova, DN Nagar and Azad Nagar increased by over 17% after the closure of Gokhale bridge, which connected the east and west sides of Andheri. The overall ridership on Versova-Andheri-Ghatkopar blue line increased by around 11,000 passengers yesterday (till 5 pm), compared to last Monday, according to Mumbai Metro One Private Limited's data.

279.title: Deloitte India fires employee who ran global hacking gang that targeted ex-Pak PM
279.article_body: Deloitte India has fired Aditya Jain, a 31-year-old employee who ran a global hacking group named 'WhiteInt' out of a Gurugram apartment. He ran a network of hackers who were hired to steal email inboxes of their targets. Jain's firm reportedly targeted former Pakistan PM Pervez Musharraf, BMW co-owner Stefan Quandt and members of UK's wealthiest families, including Ashok Hinduja.

280.title: Bus meets with an accident in J&K's Handwara; 20 people injured
280.article_body: At least 20 people were injured after a bus they were travelling in met with an accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Handwara on Tuesday. Officials said that the bus had turned turtle while on its way to Srinagar, Kashmir News Observer reported. Earlier, six people were injured in a car accident on the snow-covered Gulmarg-Butapathri road, a press release said.

281.title: Cong's Krishna Kumar Pandey dies while participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra
281.article_body: Congress leader Krishna Kumar Pandey died on Tuesday while participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra which entered Maharashtra. "Pandey, General Secretary of Seva Dal, was holding the national flag and walking with Digvijaya Singh and me...He handed the flag to a colleague...Thereafter he collapsed," Congress' Jairam Ramesh tweeted. Pandey was taken to hospital where he was declared dead, Ramesh stated.

282.title: Shocking that no one apologised: Chidambaram on Morbi bridge collapse
282.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said it is shocking that no one has apologised or resigned for the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy in Gujarat. He added, "Gujarat is governed from Delhi and not by the Chief Minister." "ED and CBI are working at BJP's behest, 95% of those arrested by such agencies are Opposition politicians," Chidambaram stated.

283.title: 21-yr-old threatens & harasses former schoolmate, arrested in Chennai
283.article_body: The Chennai Police on Monday arrested a 21-year-old, identified as V Gautham, for allegedly harassing a 19-year-old woman and threatening to upload her pictures on the internet if she didn't continue her relations with him. The victim and accused were schoolmates. He approached her on November 4 and when she refused to talk to him, he created a ruckus.

284.title: N Korea denies US claims of sending weapons to Russia amid Ukraine war
284.article_body: North Korea has denied US claims that it is shipping artillery shells and ammunition to Russia to be used in the war against Ukraine. This comes after North Korea conducted a series of weapons tests which included short-range and intercontinental missiles. Pyongyang said it was testing weapons to "mercilessly" strike key US and South Korean targets if it chooses to.

285.title: 2 Nigerian TikTok stars to be whipped 20 times for mocking govt official
285.article_body: A judge in Nigeria has ordered two TikTok stars to be given 20 lashes each, pay a $22 fine and clean the court for 30 days after they used the social media app to mock a government official. Mubarak Isa Muhammed and Muhammed Bula allegedly defamed Kano State's Governor, Abdullahi Ganduje, by saying he's corrupt, sells people's land and oversleeps.

286.title: Still processing Chadwick Boseman's loss: 'Black Panther...' actress Lupita
286.article_body: 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' actress Lupita Nyong'o said the team is still processing the loss of Chadwick Boseman. "Chadwick left a very big hole," she said, adding that the sequel "honours" the actor's legacy. She added that she's "glad" the makers "didn't replace" Chadwick and is hopeful that the film will encourage people who've lost hope to move forward.

287.title: Anti-dumping duty on Chinese metal cutter wheels not to be imposed
287.article_body: As the Finance Ministry has not accepted the recommendations of the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) for imposing anti-dumping duty on Chinese metal cutter wheels, the government has decided not to impose the levy. DGTR, under the Commerce Ministry, conducted a probe into the alleged dumping of "Resin Bonded Thin Wheels" from China and recommended imposition of the duty.

288.title: Not dying anytime soon: Samantha after media calls Myositis diagnosis 'life-threatening'
288.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who recently revealed that she has been diagnosed with autoimmune condition Myositis, has clarified that her Myositis is not at a stage that is life-threatening. "I saw a lot of articles describing my condition as life-threatening. But the stage I am in, it's not life-threatening for me. I am not dying anytime soon," she said.

289.title: Man's 'UFO' pic to friend amid smog in Delhi goes viral
289.article_body: A picture sent by a man to his friend amid the smog in Delhi has gone viral on social media. The man's friend shared the picture of a "flying saucer" in Delhi which turned out to be a water tower. Reacting to the picture, that looked similar to a "UFO", a user wrote, "That really is very depressing."

290.title: UP court defers verdict on plea for Shivling worship at Gyanvapi mosque
290.article_body: A fast-track court in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, on Tuesday didn't pronounce a verdict on the maintainability of the plea seeking the worship of Shivling that the Hindu side claimed was found on the premises of the Gyanvapi mosque. The matter will be heard on November 14. The plea also demands handing over complex to Hindus and banning entry of Muslims.

291.title: Can't fire that many people & expect site to be healthy: Early Twitter investor on layoffs
291.article_body: One of Twitter's early investors, Chris Sacca, has shared a thread about Elon Musk's takeover of the social media company. Talking about the recent layoffs at the company, Sacca wrote, "So much product and policy talent was pushed out the company door...you just can't fire that many engineers, ops, and SREs and expect the site to stay healthy."

292.title: What did SC say on acquitting 3 men sentenced to death for rape-murder of 19-yr-old girl?
292.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday acquitted three men sentenced to death by a trial court for the gangrape and murder of a 19-year-old girl in Delhi in 2012. The court said the prosecution, whose case rested on circumstantial evidence, had failed to prove it. "The court has noticed many glaring lapses having occurred during the course of the trial," it added.

293.title: Was diagnosed with spondylitis during 'Jhalak...': Paras Kalnawat
293.article_body: Actor Paras Kalnawat revealed that he was diagnosed with spondylitis during 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. He said that he also had muscle tear in his knees but he didn't want to quit the show as it "was more important" to him than his health. "I've been popping medicines and muscle relaxants to not feel the pain while rehearsing," he added.

294.title: Haryana woman sarpanch arrested for booth capturing in panchayat polls
294.article_body: A newly-elected woman sarpanch was arrested for her alleged involvement in capturing a booth in the November 2 panchayat elections in Haryana's Nuh, police said. "After filing an FIR, we investigated and found the involvement of the newly-elected sarpanch Rashida and arrested her. We are also verifying the role of others and they will be arrested soon," police added.

295.title: Smoke weed but understand importance of water conservation: BJP MP
295.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Janardan Mishra said that he does not have a problem if people chew tobacco, drink alcohol, smoke weed, inhale thinner or spend money on religious works. "But do understand the importance of water conservation," he said at a workshop. He added that water must be saved and that lands are running dry.

296.title: 3 police jurisdictions in Pune to get new deputy commissioners of police
296.article_body: The three police jurisdictions in the Pune district, Pune City, Pimpri Chinchwad and Pune rural, will get new deputy commissioners of police (DCPs). The new Pune city DCPs will be Sandeep Singh Gill, Shashikant Borate, Smartana Patil, Vijaykumar Magar, Vikrant Deshmukh, Suhail Sharma and Amol Zende. This comes after the Maharashtra Home Department ordered the reshuffle of 104 police officers.

297.title: No player has the guts to even attempt Suryakumar's scoop shot: Kaif
297.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said he doesn't think "any player has the guts to even attempt" the scoop shot played by Suryakumar Yadav. "Every player...[is fearful] that the ball will splice off the bat and hit the grill," added Kaif. "However, Suryakumar's different, forget the fear of getting hit, he's scoring [the] bulk of his runs with that...shot," he stated.

298.title: Chris Evans named 2022's Sexiest Man Alive by People magazine
298.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Evans has been named as People magazine's 'Sexiest Man Alive' for 2022. The 41-year-old 'Captain America' actor said that the title "feels like a weird form of humble bragging" and added, "My mom will be so happy." Actor Paul Rudd was named the Sexiest Man Alive by the magazine last year.

299.title: PM Modi visits Advani's residence on his birthday, Shah extends greetings
299.article_body: On the occasion of BJP leader Lal Krishna Advani's 95th birthday, PM Modi visited his residence this morning and extended his greetings. Union Home Minister Amit Shah also wished the leader and said, "Advani ji, with his relentless efforts, strengthened the party...across the country and also made [an] invaluable contribution to the country's development while being part of the government."

300.title: BJP's double-engine govt will derail soon: Sachin Pilot in Himachal
300.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday said that the double-engine government of BJP will derail soon. While addressing a press conference in Himachal Pradesh, Pilot said, "One engine of the government of double engine will seize to function on November 12 and the other in 2024." "There is infighting in BJP in the state," he stated.

301.title: Elon Musk shares rules for using Twitter, says 'They will evolve over time'
301.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Monday shared rules that users must follow while using the microblogging site and wrote, "Twitter rules will evolve over time." While the rules largely appeared to be the same as before, a new section on 'Misleading and Deceptive Identities' has been added. It forbids users against impersonating others to mislead, confuse or deceive people.

302.title: Women would take sand & put it in their maang: Janhvi on Rajesh Khanna
302.article_body: Discussing the star culture in Bollywood, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "My father Boney Kapoor...[would tell] stories about how Rajesh Khanna's car would drive away and women would take the sand and put it in their maang." "[They wouldn't]...do that for anyone today," added Janhvi. Talking about Rajesh Khanna, actor Vijay Deverakonda had stated, "Me and the generation after...don't care."

303.title: NVIDIA to sell new advanced chip to China that meets US export rules
303.article_body: NVIDIA Corporation is offering a new advanced chip, called the A800, to China that meets US' export control rules. This is the first by a US semiconductor company to create advanced processors for China according to the new rules. US in October announced export controls limiting sale of semiconductor technology to China to cripple Beijing's ability to access critical technologies.

304.title: 8 arrested for performing car stunts that killed ragpicker in Gurugram
304.article_body: Eight people were arrested in connection with the death of a 50-year-old ragpicker, who was knocked down by a person performing car stunts allegedly under the influence of alcohol in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar, the police said. CCTV cameras showed around 10-12 youths performing stunts using three cars in front of a liquor outlet on Sunday, the police said.

305.title: 19-yr-old attacked with iron rods & sickles by 20 youths in Pune, dies
305.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died after he was allegedly attacked with iron rods and sickles by nearly 20-22 youngsters in the Talegaon Dabhade area of Pune on Sunday. Police have apprehended nine accused, including four minors. The incident happened after the deceased's friend and one of the accused got into an argument. The deceased fell down while running, said police.

306.title: PM Modi visiting Karnataka as election is fast approaching: Siddaramaiah
306.article_body: Ahead of PM Modi's visit to Bengaluru on November 11, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said that PM is coming to Karnataka because Assembly election is fast approaching. He also questioned his contributions to the state. "What has [PM] done [for Karnataka]? When there were floods, he did not come, did not hear out the woes of the people," said Siddaramaiah.

307.title: Conor McGregor shares pics of his physical transformation
307.article_body: Ex-UFC featherweight and lightweight champion Conor McGregor took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation. The pictures show McGregor at over 65 kg in 2015, at over 70 kg in 2021 and at a predicted 77 kg in 2022. "You're at least 190 pounds (86 kg) right now," a fan wrote. "When will you fight?" asked another fan.

308.title: Britney Spears reveals she has incurable nerve damage, says 'it feels like needles'
308.article_body: Britney Spears has revealed she's suffering from incurable nerve damage. "Nerves are tiny and it feels like pins and needles from the right side of my body, it shoots up to my neck," she wrote. She said she doesn't feel the pain while dancing, adding, "I finally found a medication where I actually feel oxygen going to my brain."

309.title: Teacher undergoes gender change surgery to become male, marries student in Rajasthan
309.article_body: A physical education teacher in Rajasthan's Bharatpur has undergone a gender change surgery to become a male and married his student. "I always wished to undergo surgery to change my gender. I had my first surgery in December 2019," said Aarav Kuntal. "I loved him...Even if he had not done this surgery, I would have married him," said Kalpana.

310.title: Musk is alone right now & is winging this: Twitter's early investor Chris Sacca
310.article_body: Venture capitalist Chris Sacca, one of the first investors in Twitter, shared a thread about Elon Musk’s takeover of Twitter. Sacca wrote, "I've known Elon a long time. I've admired his thinking & ambition….His success to date is not an accident….He has plenty of "pals"...But the hard truth is that he is straight-up alone right now and winging this."

311.title: Iranians knock off, steal clerics' turbans in protest against veil
311.article_body: Amid the anti-veil protests in Iran, protestors have now started knocking off and stealing the turbans worn by religious clerics. The protests began after the death of Mahsa Amini. The 22-year-old died on September 16 after being allegedly assaulted by the country's morality police for not wearing the hijab properly.

312.title: Being a new mom is insane, my son is the happiest boy: Rihanna
312.article_body: Singer Rihanna said that her baby boy is "the happiest baby" and added that whenever he smiles "everything else just goes away". Rihanna gave birth to her baby boy in May this year. She further added that being a new mother has been "insane" and "epic". On the work front, Rihanna sang Black Panther: Wakanda Forever's song 'Lift Me Up'.

313.title: UP CM orders CBI probe into AYUSH admission scam, 2 officials suspended
313.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday ordered a CBI investigation into the alleged scam of "fraudulent admissions" to Ayurveda and Unani colleges under the AYUSH Department through NEET-2021. The Acting Director (AYUSH) SN Singh, and the In-charge Official of Education Directorate (AYUSH) Umakant Yadav have been suspended. "Action against two other officials...underway," an official said.

314.title: All decisions made with Anushka's consent, it's not because she's bossy: Aditya
314.article_body: Actor Aditya Seal said that every decision that he makes is with the consent of actress-wife Anushka Ranjan. "That's not because she's bossy or she has to know everything that's happening. It's just that we're living a life together. Our decisions affect each other...We take every call together, irrespective of whether it pertains to her life or mine," he added.

315.title: Man sets ablaze wife, her son and live-in partner in Hyderabad
315.article_body: A man set ablaze wife, her son and live-in partner in Hyderabad's Chikkadpally by pouring petrol on them while they were near a flower shop. The accused Nagula Sai married S Aarthi eight years ago but due to some clashes between them, they started living separately. Later, Aarthi got acquainted with Nagaraju and they both had a son named Vishnu.

316.title: 'Twitter usage is at an all-time high lol,' tweets Elon Musk; shares graphs
316.article_body: Twitter's new owner and the world's richest person Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted that the social media platform's "usage is at an all-time high lol". In another tweet he wrote, "I just hope the servers don't melt!" Musk later shared graphs showing a surge in Twitter's monetisable daily active users (mDAUs) globally and in the US since July this year.

317.title: Service flat owners to be penalised for allowing parties without permits in Hyd
317.article_body: Cyberabad Police in Hyderabad warned service apartments' owners against renting out apartments without collecting ID proofs, phone numbers and allowing guests to occupy them temporarily. "Permission from GHMC...other departments concerned should be obtained before renting out premises for parties...Legal action to be initiated if management shows any negligence," DCP (Madhapur) K Shilpavali said.

318.title: NZ mosque shooter who killed 51 files appeal against life sentence
318.article_body: An Australian terrorist who killed 51 Muslim worshippers at two mosques in New Zealand's Christchurch in March 2019 has filed an appeal against his life sentence, a court spokesperson said. Brenton Tarrant was sentenced to life in prison without parole in 2020 after he pleaded guilty to 51 counts of murder, 40 counts of attempted murder and a terrorism charge.

319.title: Aurobindo Pharma recalls medicines in US due to manufacturing lapses
319.article_body: Aurobindo Pharma USA is recalling 9,504 bottles of medication used to treat high blood pressure from the US market, the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) said. The lot has been recalled due to "current good manufacturing practices CGMP deviations," USFDA added. The recalled Quinapril and Hydrochlorothiazide tablets were manufactured in India and marketed in US by Aurobindo Pharma USA.

320.title: Hopefully, we can shut him down: Stokes on Suryakumar ahead of T20 WC semis
320.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said that they'll have to shut India's Suryakumar Yadav down before he "gets on one of his rampages" in their 2022 T20 World Cup semi-final on Thursday. "Suryakumar plays some shots where you're scratching your head sometimes," added Stokes. "Thursday is all about which team turns up and can perform best," he further said.

321.title: Few areas near B'luru to face power cuts on Wednesday and Thursday
321.article_body: A few areas near Bengaluru will face power cuts on Wednesday and Thursday due to maintenance work being undertaken by KPTCL. The outage will last for six hours from 10 am-4 pm, data on BESCOM website suggested. The work will be initiated in Ramanagara circle and the areas likely to be affected are Harohalli, T K Halli and Somanahalli.

322.title: It's the worst draw: Barca manager Xavi on being drawn against Man Utd
322.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi termed being drawn against Manchester United in the Europa League playoffs as the "worst draw" that his team could have got. "The draw has given us the most difficult rival again, like in the Champions League group stage...Once again. No luck," added Xavi. "It is a massive challenge for us...We will have to compete," he stated.

323.title: Never refused to negotiate with Russia, will talk to Putin's successor: Ukraine
323.article_body: Mykhailo Podolyak, a senior adviser to Ukrainian President has said that Kyiv never refused to negotiate with Moscow and will hold talks with future Russian leader but not Vladimir Putin as he is not ready. The comments come after The Washington Post reported that the Biden administration was privately encouraging Ukrainian leaders to signal openness to hold talks with Moscow.

324.title: World is on highway to climate hell: UN chief warns at COP27 summit
324.article_body: Addressing world leaders at the COP27 climate summit in Egypt on Monday, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned that the world is "on the highway to climate hell with our foot still on the accelerator". He added that "we are in the fight of our lives, and we are losing" as greenhouse gas emissions and global temperatures are still rising.

325.title: India reports lowest daily COVID-19 cases in 7 months with 625 new infections
325.article_body: India has reported 625 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, which is the lowest single-day rise in the number of cases in over seven months. This comes a day after the country reported 937 fresh COVID-19 cases. No deaths were reported in the last 24 hours due to coronavirus. The active cases in India stand at 14,021.

326.title: Messi is obsessed with scoring goals, Neymar has an animal inside: Alves
326.article_body: Ex-Barcelona footballer Dani Alves said Lionel Messi is "obsessed" with scoring goals, adding that all he thinks about is scoring goals. "Neymar has an animal inside, which...[comes out] when people...[try] to harm it...Then you're dead," added Alves. "When I played against...[them], I told my teammates, 'Don't beat them up, don't let the animal inside these guys wake up'," he stated.

327.title: Maharashtra to enter 'red zone' for aerosol pollution in 2023: Study
327.article_body: According to a study, Maharashtra may breathe more toxic air in 2023. The aerosol pollution levels are likely to enter the "red zone" category, which is considered highly vulnerable. It may lead to a drop in visibility levels and pose a host of health problems for people. The aerosol optical depth can be used as a proxy measurement of PM2.5.

328.title: Amid rising traffic chaos, PMC serves notice to Maha-Metro, PMRDA
328.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has served notices to Maha-Metro and Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) amid criticism over rising traffic chaos. A PMC official said that it was realised that barricading work for Metro and flyover work was one of the reasons for traffic chaos and at some places, it was done where "no work had started at all".

329.title: Mumbai auto driver breaks into sister's house, steals ₹26 lakh
329.article_body: A 35-year-old autorickshaw driver has been arrested for allegedly breaking into his sister's house and decamping with valuables worth ₹26.6 lakh in Maharashtra's Thane district, the police said. The accused had fled with his entire family after committing the crime, the police added. The police arrested the accused, who had fled to Vapi in neighbouring Gujarat, based on a tip-off.

330.title: French Cardinal admits to abusing teen 35 years ago, ends religious duties
330.article_body: France's Cardinal Jean-Pierre Ricard admitted on Monday that he had abused a 14-year-old girl 35 years ago, announcing withdrawal from his religious duties. "35 years ago, when I was a priest, I behaved in a reprehensible way towards a girl aged 14...no doubt that my behaviour caused serious and long-lasting consequences for that person," Ricard said.

331.title: Where do broken hearts go: Sania Mirza in post amid rumours of divorce with Shoaib Malik
331.article_body: Amid rumours that Sania Mirza and Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Malik are parting ways, the Indian tennis star shared a cryptic story on Instagram. "Where do broken hearts go? To find Allah," the post read. Sania and Shoaib tied the knot in 2010 and have a four-year-old son Izhaan. Earlier, Pakistani media reports suggested Shoaib cheated on Sania.

332.title: North Korea releases pics of its series of missile launches
332.article_body: North Korea's Korean Central News Agency has released pictures of the country's series of missile launches. North Korea fired 23 missiles on Wednesday last week, a record for a single day. North Korea on Monday said that the launches were simulated strikes on South Korea and US as the two countries held a "dangerous war drill".

333.title: With 'mashaal' in hand, Rahul Gandhi enters Maha for Bharat Jodo Yatra
333.article_body: Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra, led by party leader Rahul Gandhi, entered Maharashtra on Monday night. Gandhi along with other party leaders held 'mashaal' in their hands. Gandhi said during his stay in Maharashtra over the next 15 days, he will listen to the voice of the state and also its pain. He stated that no force can stop his yatra.

334.title: Sanfe raises $1.5 million in funding round from existing investors
334.article_body: Sanfe, a brand offering women's hygiene products, has raised $1.5 million in a funding round from existing investors such as S Chand Family Office, Seeders, LetsVenture and angel investors including Abhay Tandon and Yash Kotak. Last year, Sanfe raised $1 million in a Series A funding round. With the latest funding round, Sanfe has raised $2.5 million in all.

335.title: Fresh non-bailable warrant against Maha MP, father in fake caste case
335.article_body: A court issued a fresh non-bailable warrant (NBW) against Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her father in a fake caste certificate case. The two are accused of forging a caste certificate as the seat from where she is elected is reserved for SC candidates. An NBW was issued against them in September which is yet to be executed.

336.title: Woman attacks Emirates airline employee, vandalises Mexico airport after missing flight
336.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a woman attacking an Emirates airline check-in staff at Mexico City International Airport after arriving late and attempting to use an expired passport for which  she was refused to travel. Video showed that she climbed over the counter, entering check-in desks, throwing equipment on the floor and shouting. The woman was eventually removed by security.

337.title: Rohit Sharma suffers injury scare ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final
337.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma suffered an injury scare while batting in the nets ahead of T20 World Cup semi-final against England. Rohit was hit on his right forearm while attempting to hit a pull shot. He seemed to be in pain and discontinued the net session instantly. He was attended to by team physio and team doctor.

338.title: Fugitive arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari to be extradited to India, orders UK court
338.article_body: A UK court has ordered the extradition of fugitive arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari to India to face charges of tax evasion and money laundering. The 60-year-old is accused of concealing assets, using backdated documents, benefiting from the assets not declared to Indian tax authorities and then falsely informing authorities he didn't possess any overseas assets.

339.title: If you had 6 Suryakumars, I'd have all of them in my team: Tom Moody
339.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Tom Moody has said India should keep Suryakumar Yadav at the number four position as the 32-year-old seems "comfortable" and is in "red-hot form". Moody added, "If you had six Suryakumars, I'd have all six of them in my team...He can bat anywhere. No question about that." Suryakumar is currently the top-ranked T20I batter in the world.

340.title: All construction sites in Delhi-NCR must use anti-smog guns: CAQM
340.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has directed all construction and demolition sites in Delhi-NCR to deploy anti-smog guns. The commission said that deployment of an anti-smog gun is mandatory for construction sites of over 5,000 square metres (sqm). Moreover, it has directed pollution control boards in Delhi-NCR to ensure the continuous and effective use of these anti-smog guns.

341.title: Strong impression Putin will skip G20: Indonesia Prez Widodo
341.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo said he got a "strong impression" that Russian President Vladimir Putin wouldn't attend the G20 summit in Bali, based on a conversation last week. Widodo expressed concern that the gathering could be overshadowed by a "very worrying" rise in international tensions. "G20 isn't meant to be a political forum. It's meant to be about...development," he added.

342.title: Nigerian Instagram influencer 'Hushpuppi' jailed for 11 years in US for fraud
342.article_body: Nigerian Instagram influencer Ramon Abbas, also known as 'Hushpuppi', has been jailed for over 11 years in the US for his role in a global theft and a money-laundering scam. Abbas, who flaunted his wealthy lifestyle on his Instagram page, had pleaded guilty in 2021 to money laundering, which included helping North Korean hackers launder stolen money.

343.title: Man allegedly kills his 25-year-old friend in Thane's Bhiwandi; arrested
343.article_body: Thane Police arrested a man for allegedly killing his 25-year-old friend, Shamim, in Bhiwandi while he was sleeping inside his hotel on Monday. "[He was] murdered late at night between 1:30 am and 2:00 am. The accused ran away from the spot…[The] body was lying in a pool of blood [at the hotel's door]," said a police officer.

344.title: Australia announce squad for ODI series against England
344.article_body: Australia have announced their squad for the upcoming ODI series against England. It'll be the first ODI series for Australia under Pat Cummins' captaincy. Travis Head has been included in the squad and is expected to open in the series. He has been selected in place of Aaron Finch, who retired from ODI cricket. The squad also features Cameron Green.

345.title: Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' with 321 AQI; Noida's AQI at 354
345.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Tuesday morning was recorded in the 'very poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 321. The AQI in Noida also stood in the 'very poor' category at 354, while in Gurugram it stood at 326, as per SAFAR's data. The AQI in Delhi on Monday was recorded at 326.

346.title: No skin show, wind machine kept Sridevi's saree flowing: Boney on 'Kate...'
346.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor said that there was "not even a slight skin show" in the song 'Kate Nahin Kat Te'. "We [added] red glass house and red mirrors to cleverly picturise that Anil is singing the song." He also said it was the first time a wind machine was used to keep actress Sridevi's hair and saree flowing.

347.title: Never imagined myself doing action: Samantha on 'Yashoda'
347.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who will be seen performing action sequences in her upcoming film 'Yashoda', said she had "never imagined" herself doing action. "My love for the genre has been a revelation to me," she said, adding that performing action offers "an adrenaline rush" and "a sense of accomplishment". 'Yashoda' has been shot in Tamil and Telugu.

348.title: Paytm Q2 net loss widens to ₹571.5 crore y-o-y, revenue up by 76%
348.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications reported a consolidated loss of ₹571.5 crore for the quarter ended September, widening from a loss of ₹473.5 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. However, the loss narrowed from ₹645.4 crore in Q1 FY23. Its consolidated revenue from operations surged by 76.2% to ₹1,914 crore. A surge in loan growth drove the jump.

349.title: Mobile kitchen van launched for police on VVIP duties in Sangrur
