349.article_body: Punjab's Sangrur Police have launched a mobile kitchen van for police deployed on VVIP duties and protest sites. The SSP said that the initiative has been launched as police personnel remain on their duties for hours and don't get time to have meals. There was also a problem in distribution and preparation of food at different places, the SSP added.

350.title: I'm doing much better: Varun on battle with vestibular hypofunction
350.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, who recently opened up about his vestibular hypofunction diagnosis, said he's doing "much better with the help of yoga, swimming...Above all, the blessings of God". He added, "The amount of concern and love that has followed has left me humbled and very energised to get back to 100%." Varun is currently busy with the promotions of 'Bhediya'.

351.title: If people like my pics, I'll get another brand, will pay EMIs with ease: Janhvi
351.article_body: While talking about her social media presence, actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she does not want to take it so seriously and wants to have fun with it. "Hopefully, if I look cute and five extra people like my pictures, I will get another brand and I will be able to pay for my EMIs with more ease," she added.

352.title: Remove K'taka leader over his 'Hindu' remark: BJP leader to Cong
352.article_body: BJP leader Arun Singh has said Congress should remove its KPCC Working President  Satish Jarkiholi if it doesn't agree with his remarks on the word 'Hindu'. In a video, Jarkiholi claimed the word 'Hindu' hails from Persia and added, "You'll be ashamed to know its meaning...its meaning is very dirty." Earlier, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala had called Jarkiholi's statement unfortunate.

353.title: Mother & son die of dengue, health dept says no death from disease in Mohali
353.article_body: A mother and her son died within a span of 24 hours in Mohali's Abrawan village, with family claiming that both had contracted dengue and subsequently succumbed to the disease. The sarpanch of Abrawan village claimed that their dengue reports had returned positive. However, the Mohali health department said that no dengue deaths had taken place in the district.

354.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of robbing, occupying empty houses in Kherson
354.article_body: Ukraine has accused Russia of robbing and occupying empty houses in the southern city of Kherson. Ukraine has said that Russia's recent order to evacuate civilians from Kherson is forced deportation which amounts to a war crime. Kherson, which had a population of nearly 3,00,000 before the war, has been without electricity and water for over two days.

355.title: US businessman wins record $75 million in legal sports betting history
355.article_body: US businessman Jim McIngvale, known as 'Mattress Mack', has won $75 million in the largest payout in legal sports betting history. He made a series of bets amounting to $10 million on Houston Astros winning baseball World Series. Sharing a photo of himself with a suitcase full of cash on Twitter, the 71-year-old wrote, "How tweet it is 75 million."

356.title: You can resist moonlighting but can't stop it: Former HCL Tech CEO
356.article_body: Former HCL Technologies CEO Vineet Nayar remarked that "moonlighting is an unstoppable event. You can resist it but you can't stop it." Nayar explained that there are three reasons causing moonlighting in the IT sector- the widening gap between the salaries of freshers and top management, the lack of purpose and innovation in IT companies and the growing start-up culture.

357.title: Stones pelted at train in which Owaisi was travelling: AIMIM leader
357.article_body: AIMIM leader Waris Pathan alleged on Monday that stones were pelted at a coach of Vande Bharat Express in which party chief Asaduddin Owaisi was travelling. Owaisi, Pathan and AIMIM Gujarat President Sabir Kabliwala were travelling from Ahmedabad to Surat. Sharing pictures of the incident, he tweeted, "Some unidentified people broke the glass by pelting stones at the train."

358.title: Blockchain startup Dhiway raises $1 million in pre-seed round
358.article_body: Blockchain startup Dhiway has raised $1 million in a pre-seed round led by Cornerstone Venture Partners Fund, SUNiCON Ventures and its existing shareholders. Founded in 2019, the Bengaluru-based startup operates and maintains India's first verifiable data exchange platform, #MARK Studio, that enables companies to deploy governance frameworks to carry these as sustainable digital assets.

359.title: 85 pigs die from African Swine Fever in MP's Katni; survey ongoing
359.article_body: As many as 85 pigs have died from African Swine Fever and 115 others have been infected by the virus in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, an official said on Monday. A survey is being conducted and it's likely to be completed within two days, following which, the infected pigs will be culled, the district's Incharge Deputy Director Veterinary RK Singh said.

360.title: If I was Babar, I'd get hold of the guy making video: Akram on dressing room footage
360.article_body: Reacting to PCB sharing video of Babar Azam's speech in dressing room after Pakistan qualified for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals, Wasim Akram said, "If I was Babar...I'd get hold of the guy making...video." He added, "Some things are personal...I haven’t seen any other team do this in...World Cup...The urge to get extra numbers...cut it down. It’s just too much."

361.title: 'Twitter usage is at an all-time high lol,' tweets Elon Musk
361.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Monday tweeted that the social media platform's "usage is at an all-time high lol". In another tweet he wrote, "I just hope the servers don't melt!" Musk didn't provide any evidence or explain how he defines usage. Twitter has added over 15 million monetisable daily active users (mDAU) since July, The Verge reported.

362.title: 4 including 3 students returning from exam killed as dumper overturns on auto in Maharashtra
362.article_body: As many as four persons, including 3 students, were killed after a dumper full of sand overturned on an auto-rickshaw in Maharashtra's Raigarh, police said. The three students were returning after taking an exam and were killed along with the auto driver on the spot, police added. Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde announced ₹5 lakh financial assistance to the deceased's families.

363.title: 3 killed, 25 injured as tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims overturns on bridge in MP
363.article_body: At least three people were killed while 25 others were injured after a tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims from Bhind district overturned on a bridge in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district. State Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan expressed his condolences. "I pray to God to grant the departed souls a place at his feet and a speedy recovery [for] the injured," he tweeted.

364.title: Actress Rebel Wilson welcomes baby via surrogate; shares 1st pic
364.article_body: Actress Rebel Wilson has announced that she has welcomed her first child, a baby girl named Royce Lillian. In an Instagram post, Wilson said her daughter was born "this past week via surrogate". "I can't even describe the love I have for her, she's a beautiful miracle! I am forever grateful to everyone who has been involved," she wrote.

365.title: 'Stop licking toxic toad,' US govt body warns people, releases pic
365.article_body: The US' National Park Service has warned people against touching or licking toxic Sonoran Desert toad, also known as Colorado River toad. "These toads have prominent parotid glands that secrete a potent toxin. It can make you sick if you handle the frog or get poison in your mouth," it stated. The toxics can cause hallucinations and psychoactive reactions.

366.title: Centre's policies broke backbone of farmers, small businesses: Rahul
366.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi and said that his policies have broken the backbone of small businesses and farmers while benefitting selected businessmen. "Unemployment is increasing in the country…The truth [about] India is that the country cannot give employment to its youth…The government extends all the profit to selected two-three people," said Rahul.

367.title: 26 Congress leaders join BJP ahead of Himachal Pradesh elections
367.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections on November 12, as many as 26 Congress party leaders joined BJP on Monday. BJP leader and Himachal CM Jairam Thakur tweeted, "Customs are changing...many colleagues including former office bearers of Congress...joined BJP." Among those who left Congress includes Dharampal Thakur Khand, former General Secretary of the Pradesh Congress Committee.

368.title: Your business, your decision: Mark Cuban as Musk rejects his advice on $8 blue tick fee
368.article_body: Elon Musk rejected a suggestion by billionaire Mark Cuban regarding offering the $8 verification program to some users for free. Cuban suggested an $8 verification fee could be waived for the "most accurate" users of a new Notes feature to ensure accuracy, to which Musk replied, "$8 for all." Cuban then responded, "Your business. Your decision."

369.title: Noida Traffic Police to give AQI updates on its social media handles
369.article_body: Noida Traffic Police said that it will take steps to regularly update its social media platforms with air quality index (AQI) data as the pollution levels continue to remain in "very poor" category. People don't always get the correct pollution data and most don't even know where to look for official information pertaining to their locality, senior traffic officers said.

370.title: Would hide & watch him perform: Neena on working with Amitabh Bachchan
370.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta revealed that she "would hide and watch" Amitabh Bachchan perform on the sets of 'Uunchai'. "I addressed him as Amit bhai. He is the most committed and amazing actor. Kaam hi unki tapasya hai (Work is worship for him)," she said. Neena was previously seen sharing screen space with Amitabh Bachchan in Vikas Bahl's 'Goodbye'.

371.title: Rohit's getting out trying to execute concept which he started: Gavaskar
371.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Rohit Sharma is getting dismissed while trying to score as much as possible in the powerplay during the T20 World Cup 2022, terming it as a concept which Rohit started. "Rohit has set this template...to go bang, bang and bang. Suddenly, he can't be seen looking to work the ball around," added Gavaskar.

372.title: NCP leader stops screening of Marathi film on Chhatrapati Shivaji in Thane
372.article_body: NCP leader Jitendra Awhad forcefully stopped screening of Marathi movie 'Har Har Mahadev' at a multiplex in Thane on Monday night alleging that the movie showcases wrong history about Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Awhad's supporters also allegedly manhandled viewer who tried to stop them. People are influenced by movies and we won't let them change history, the former Maharashtra minister said.

373.title: USFDA finds procedural lapses at Lupin's Nagpur injectables facility
373.article_body: US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) issued a Form-483 after finding procedural lapses at Lupin's injectables manufacturing facility in Nagpur. The USFDA conducted the inspection from October 17-29 and found lapses on five counts, including flooring, walls and ceiling of the aseptic processing areas at the facility. "We're committed to addressing the observations at the earliest," Lupin said.

374.title: If Pak win T20 WC, Raja shouldn't claim credit for team selection: Amir
374.article_body: Talking about PCB chief Ramiz Raja, ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir said, "It's a request to [him] that if Pakistan win, then...[he shouldn't]...say [he] selected this team." "When the team was losing...everyone was hiding. Don't fool us. We all know where the selection...[went] wrong," added Amir. Amir earlier termed the selection of Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 as "poor".

375.title: Hyd's 50% rescued snakes are venomous, learned to stay with humans: Report
375.article_body: Fifty per cent of snakes rescued in Hyderabad are venomous cobras who genetically learned to stay alongside humans, reports said. Avinash Viswanathan, General Secretary of Friends of Snakes Society (FoSS), said that the snakes tend to come out in the month of October. He said that the sightings become more and rescue calls come from various locations in the city.

376.title: They took out 3 bullets from my right leg: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan
376.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Monday claimed that three bullets were taken out of his right leg while some shrapnel was left inside his left leg after he was attacked last week. He claimed the attack against him was conceived two months ago and blamed the incumbent government for the attack. "It was a planned assassination attempt," he added.

377.title: IFS officer shares pics of Puri beaches covered with flowers
377.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda has shared pictures of two beaches in Odisha's Puri covered with flowers. "The 'Beach of flowers'. Puri has two stretch of cleanest & most serene beaches- Golden & Niladri. Move over the Valley of flowers...Sand dunes covered with natural sand binders in full bloom," he tweeted. Golden Beach has received the Blue Flag certification.

378.title: People offer namaz on street in Ghaziabad; FIR filed against imam
378.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have filed an FIR against the imam of a mosque in Khoda for allegedly violating prohibitory orders after taking suo motu cognisance of a picture of people offering namaz on a street in the area. "About 25-30 people came late for...Friday prayers and on not finding space in the mosque, they offered the namaz on...street," the imam claimed.

379.title: 3 held for burglary at mobile phone shops in Pune, 97 devices recovered
379.article_body: Pune City Police arrested three persons for burglary at mobile phone shops and recovered 97 stolen phones worth ₹22 lakh from their possession. This comes after a man filed an FIR claiming that 109 cell phones were stolen from his shop at Uruli Devachi. Apart from cell phones, police also recovered a car and a two-wheeler from the accused.

380.title: Man gets hit by car after jumping from window of bus, dies in Pune
380.article_body: A 24-year-old man died after he was hit by a car as he jumped out onto the road from the window of a bus in Pune's Hadapsar, police said. The incident took place when a quarrel broke out between the passengers inside the bus and people who were waiting outside. A case was filed against the unidentified car driver.

381.title: UK PM Rishi Sunak rushed out of room by aides at climate summit; video goes viral
381.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was rushed out of the room by his aides at the climate summit on Monday, with a video going viral on social media. It is unclear what information Sunak received from his aides. The United Nations Climate Change Conference, commonly referred to as COP27, opened in the Egyptian resort town of Sharm el-Sheikh on Sunday.

382.title: Read on social media, got no order copy: Cong on Twitter account blocking
382.article_body: After a court in Karnataka asked Twitter to temporarily block the accounts of Congress and Bharat Jodo Yatra on Monday, the party took to Twitter to say that no copy of the order has been received. "We have read on social media about an adverse order from a Bengaluru court against INC & BJY SM handles," the tweet read.

383.title: Brazil announce their 26-man squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup
383.article_body: Brazil have announced their 26-man squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup, which will begin on November 20 in Qatar. Brazil manager Tite has included 39-year-old defender Daniel Alves in the squad, while he has left out Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino. The squad includes Neymar and Thiago Silva. As many as 12 players in the squad feature in the Premier League.

384.title: Ex-Twitter employee gets 10-yr anniversary gift from company days after being fired
384.article_body: A former Twitter manager revealed that she received a 10-year congratulatory anniversary gift from the company days after she was fired. The note read, "Congrats on reaching a huge Tweep milestone. We can't wait to see all that you accomplish this year." Elaine Filadelfo had earlier tweeted, "This is a brutal way to go after 10 years."

385.title: Delhi at 33°C records highest max temperature for November since 2008
385.article_body: Delhi on Monday recorded a maximum temperature of 33°C, making it the warmest November day in the national capital since 2008, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD). Delhi on November 4, 2008, had recorded a maximum temperature of 33.5°C, the IMD data showed. Notably, IMD has predicted that light rain is expected in Delhi towards the end of the week.

386.title: Tyson Foods CFO enters stranger's home, passes out in her bed in US; arrested
386.article_body: John Tyson, the 32-year-old CFO of Tyson Foods, was arrested for criminal trespassing and public intoxication in the US on Sunday. Tyson was found asleep in the bed of a college-aged woman at around 2 am, according to a police report. The woman called police about a potential burglary, who later arrived to find Tyson's clothing strewn on the floor.

387.title: Flipkart's losses widen 46% to over ₹7,800 crore in FY22
387.article_body: Flipkart's losses widened 46% to over ₹7,800 crore in the FY 2021-22, according to regulatory filings. The figure is based on the combined performance of its business-to-business unit Flipkart India and B2C e-commerce unit Flipkart Internet. Flipkart Internet has reported a widening of loss to ₹4,399 crore in FY22, while Flipkart India reported a widening of loss to ₹3,413 crore.

388.title: Congress Wide Ball, AAP No Ball, BJP good length delivery: Rajnath
388.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh used cricket analogies to criticise opposition parties, dubbing Congress a "Wide Ball" and AAP a "No Ball". He added that the BJP is the only "good length delivery" on the pitch of politics. Singh further said that the BJP's promise to implement the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in Himachal Pradesh is not to get votes.

389.title: Kerala govt & CPI(M) exploring legal options against Guv: Yechury
389.article_body: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said that the party and Kerala government are exploring legal options against state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan. "Constitution is clear that the Governor has to act on the guidance of the Cabinet...If he is violating it, then it needs a solution," said Yechury. He added that the Governor spends most of his time in Delhi.

390.title: BJP has formed a PIL gang in Jharkhand HC: CM Hemant Soren
390.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren alleged that the BJP has "formed a PIL gang" in the Jharkhand High Court. "I have come to know that the gang first tries to strike a deal...very unfortunate that sometimes they get protection from the court," said Soren. He added the Opposition has "no face" to hold protests as the Supreme Court gave him relief.

391.title: NIA searches 3 locations in Kerala in PFI conspiracy case
391.article_body: The NIA on Monday conducted searches at three locations in Kerala's Malappuram district in connection with the PFI conspiracy case, the agency informed. The case pertains to the conspiracy hatched by the PFI members to carry out terror acts in the country, an official said. Incriminating materials, including digital devices and documents, were recovered during the searches, the agency added.

392.title: Thrash BJP workers: Jharkhand Congress leader to UPA supporters
392.article_body: Jharkhand Congress Working President Bandhu Tirkey asked UPA supporters to "thrash" BJP workers "if required". Asking party workers to "expose the BJP", Tirkey said the UPA is not "against any investigation" as long as it is not "done with political vendetta". BJP National Vice-President Raghubar Das responded and said, "BJP workers do not get thrashed...Don't touch them even by mistake."

393.title: Probably forgot to fill fuel: Priyanka on BJP's 'double engine' govt
393.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi said that BJP's double engine government probably forgot to fill fuel in it, as it didn't fulfil promises of unemployment in Himachal Pradesh. Speaking at a rally, Priyanka said, "They (BJP) will say anything to stay in power but they forget after polls." Elections in the state will be on November 12.

394.title: Future F1 battles with Lewis Hamilton will be interesting: Verstappen
394.article_body: Current F1 world champion Max Verstappen said the prospect of competing with Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton in the future "will be interesting". "As long as he wants to keep racing, he has to keep doing that," said Verstappen, responding to reports of Hamilton's contract extension. He added that it would be interesting to see which teams "compete at the top".

395.title: Rahul running around country since I dispatched him from Amethi: Irani
395.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Monday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been running and going around the country since she dispatched him from Uttar Pradesh's Amethi. "[Congress] took out [Bharat Jodo Yatra] with those who put resolutions of separating Kashmir from India," Irani said. Congress took out Yatra with those who slaughtered cows and then uploaded photos, she added.

396.title: Annoyed by double standards: Qatar on Germany amid FIFA WC criticism
396.article_body: Qatar's Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed commented after German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser criticised Qatar for its alleged poor human rights record ahead of the FIFA World Cup 2022. "Annoyed by [German's] double standards...The German population is misinformed by politicians...on the other, the government has no problem with us when it comes to energy partnerships or investment," Sheikh said.

397.title: Stubble burning incidents in Punjab cross 30,000 mark: Data
397.article_body: After 2,487 stubble-burning cases were reported on Monday, the cumulative farm fire cases rose to 32,486 in Punjab from September 15 to November 7, according to the Ludhiana-based Punjab Remote Sensing Centre data. On Monday, Ferozepur (353) witnessed the highest number of incidents followed by Moga (268), the data said. Punjab reported 37,933 incidents during the same period in 2021.

398.title: 19-yr-old Rune defeats Novak Djokovic to win Paris Masters title
398.article_body: Danish teenager Holger Rune defeated Novak Djokovic 3-6 6-3 7-5 to win his first Masters title in Paris. "You're one of my favourite players, I've watched you since I was a kid," said the 19-year-old to Djokovic after the match. Rune, who beat four other top-10 players en route to the final, will now move into the Top 10 rankings.

399.title: Want to see India alongside Brazil at a FIFA World Cup very soon: Cafu
399.article_body: Two-time World Cup-winning Brazilian footballer Cafu said he wants to see India playing in the tournament along with his national side "very soon". Cafu, who visited Hooghly in West Bengal, said he was moved by the love of Indian people for football. The former full-back spent time with fans during his visit and also played football with children.

400.title: 12 injured after bus hits container, causes 6 vehicle pile-up in Pune
400.article_body: At least 12 persons sustained injuries after a bus hit a container on Katraj viaduct on the Mumbai-Bengaluru Highway in Pune on Monday night. "Because of this accident, a pile-up was reported with at least five to six vehicles ramming into one another. The injured persons from the bus have been shifted to a nearby private hospital," police said.
